structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Group life insurance for police and fire departments in cities of home rule class.

text.section: The legislative bodies of cities of the home rule class or urban-county governments may, by ordinance, form the members of the police and fire departments into groups to obtain the advantages of the group plan of life insurance.

The legislative bodies may aid the members of the police and fire departments by paying from city funds not to exceed fifty percent (50%) of the annual premiums on the policies, and may contract with the insurer on such other terms as may be provided for in the ordinance.

law.history: Amended 2014 Ky. Acts ch. 92, sec. 139, effective January 1, 2015. -- Amended 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 248, sec. 14. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2741u.
